Don‚Äôt get me wrong I love this game and I would play it all the time if it weren‚Äôt for these 3 minuscule problems with it. 1st thing the 4th tower in the game the far right tip is raised a little high and it‚Äôs infuriating when I get everything flat at the beginning and when I place a block it tilts inwards because I of it. 2nd thing the ice wizard and the gold power up makes the block just a smidge to big and screws up the the tower for me. 3rd thing the level 2 of the island power up(Idk if it‚Äôs all of them) is always a half block away from where the tower begins and i have to make this awkward transition a half block. Those or the only things I‚Äôve noticed and please if you can fix them I myself have OCD and these things really bug me and prevent me from playing constantly because I get bothered and upset when my tower gets nicked over because of something I can‚Äôt prevent.

Thank you so much EA for creating such a garbage Tetris app and booting all the Tetris clones. I probably never would have found this game if your Tetris app wasn‚Äôt such a piece of trash. 

I Iove this game. It is a brilliant idea, basically Tetris with physics and a few innovative twists. It is evident the creators put a lot of care into this project. It is the kind of game you play on your commute and you keep playing when you get home. l am a so happy I found it. 

My only complaint is the controls, especially when things get speedy. I think it would be better to designate an area or a space for flipping pieces and the rest of the screen for swiping left and right. Sometimes a quick swipe is interpreted as a touch/flip.

It would be awesome if i could play with friends online. But still, i love it.

A whole lot of fun, but the best part is definitely looking back at your completed tower and being able to see it all. "I was doing really well there," "I narrowly survived that bit," "The ice blocks almost got me there." It just makes a great game so much better.
I typed in tricky towers to see what would come up and I found this...ill take it :)

I am so helplessly addicted to this game. I love it. I work a weird schedule, so I could never find people to play against on PS4, so I'm incredibly thankful for the iPhone version. I only have one complaint! I use my right hand to navigate my screen, and the power ups are located on the right side, so sometimes when I'm playing, my thumb will accidentally tap over the power up and I can't take it back or undo it. This is especially frustrating on challenges to use no mana. I would love a feature that allows me to put all my power ups either at the very top or along the left, so I can have more control over when they get deployed. Other than that, I will be recommending this game to alllll my Tetris loving friends and coworkers. It's SO good.
Great game very addicting. Works well on mobile and Mac via steam
Very fun and no technical glitches to speak of
One of my favorite games. I may like the iphone version more than the ps4 version.

title.label: Just like the PS4 but needs multiplayer

content.label: It would be even better if it had a multiplayer mode added.
This game is severely underrated. It has every character trait of a classic addictive phone game, while also being very pretty to look at. I love this game.
This game is my new favorite
Literally the most addicting game! Very familiar arcade game with a twist! Great for short term or long term playtime
It's like Tetris but the object is to build a tower out of the pieces
Awesome rendition of a classic game. Don't hesitate to get it. Graphic style is fun and on point. Can't wait to see a multiplayer update to bring the feel of the console version to mobile.

Such a phenomenal game. Rarely do I take the time to write a review for an app, let alone a game, but this one deserves to be praised. Whether I have a quick few minutes to kill or an hour of waiting for my frickin girlfriend to find the right pair of shoes, 99 Bricks is what I'm playing.
